title: Liverpool, Man City and Celtic hit with UEFA fines after recent incidents

Liverpool, Manchester City and Celtic have all received fines from UEFA as a result of recent incidents in European games.

The Control, Ethics and Disciplinary Body have decided on punishments for all three British clubs after the latest set of Champions League and Europa League games which took place earlier this month.

Liverpool have been hit with a €10,000 fine after a fan ran onto the pitch in the closing stages of their 4-3 victory over RB Salzburg at Anfield.

Their opponents have also received a fine of €3,250 having been charged with throwing of objects.

Manchester City have also been charged with throwing of objects in their game against Dinamo Zagreb, receiving a €15,750 fine.

Their opponents have received the same charge as well as additional charge for acts of damage at the Etihad Stadium.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

The Croatian champions have been fined €20,000 and ordered to contact the Premier League champions within 30 days to settle the damages caused by their supporters.

They have also received a ban from selling tickets to away supporters, although that punishment is suspended for a one-year probationary period.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

Scottish giants Celtic, meanwhile, have been charged after their fans set off fireworks during their 2-0 win over CFR Cluj in the Europa League on October 3.

They have been fined €12,000 as punishment.

(Image: Garry F McHarg Daily Record)

Liverpool's fine for invasion of the pitch by supporters comes after a spate of similar incidents involving the club.

The Champions League final in Madrid was infamously disrupted by Russian model Kinsey Wolanski, but similar incidents have taken place since.

Their Premier League opener with Norwich was disrupted by a supporter from the away end, whilst a fan caused an injury to Adrian as they ran on the pitch to join celebrations after winning the UEFA Super Cup in Istanbul in August.
description: UEFA have handed down a number of fines to British clubs after the latest round of Champions League and Europa League fixtures
